channel.title: Small question about sources
channel.description:
Hi, im a newbie programmer, And I was wondering if its wise for a beginner to use a hyperion? or go with something else? I wanna start learning how to make a successful rsps & programming.
About me: I'm a really new programmer, this is to learn, and i need something [b][u]stable[/u][/b]. I wanna make a 317-474 server. I plan on learning client & server sided if possible. I know absolutely nothing about programming. I read a few things from sun.java and plan on continuing though I am confused atm.
[u]options im considering:[/u] -shards -hyperion -project insanity -runesource

item.title: Small question about sources
item.dc:creator: @Jacob5 Jacob_
item.description:
@Jacob5 wrote:

[quote=“Love_, post:7, topic:440189”][quote author=Jacob_ link=topic=542870.msg3978837#msg3978837 date=1334989501]
Use something more advanced, so you don’t get stuck using a server that is poorly programmed and get used to that programming style, so Shard, Hyperion, RuneSource = Best options.
[/quote]
Stupid.

You can always “improve your programming”, if you don’t have poor programming habits of course.

If you want to learn Java, Private servers aren’t the way to go. However, if you insist on working with them, start with Hyperion or Runesource, seeing as you have to work on the core of those two.[/quote]

Not stupid, if hes starting out and is going to use a poorly programmed base, he will pick up the bad programming habits within the base.

Read full topic

item.title: Small question about sources
item.dc:creator: @spearo spearo
item.description:
@spearo wrote:

Alright thank you. My primary goal is to learn how to make a successful rsps through coding. I do plan on learning the real Java, but that is later on due to how heavy that project is. But I read some a little bit everyday to pace myself.

Just wondering though, why isn’t rsps good for learning java? Isn’t this java based? Thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Small question about sources
item.dc:creator: @Love1 Love_
item.description:
@Love1 wrote:

Jacob_:

Use something more advanced, so you don’t get stuck using a server that is poorly programmed and get used to that programming style, so Shard, Hyperion, RuneSource = Best options.

Stupid.

You can always “improve your programming”, if you don’t have poor programming habits of course.

If you want to learn Java, Private servers aren’t the way to go. However, if you insist on working with them, start with Hyperion or Runesource, seeing as you have to work on the core of those two.

Read full topic

item.title: Small question about sources
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

202685:

^^ shut up… and yes, use either that or delta… there are way more delta tuts btw…

Lol? A base that has a lot of tutorials on it doesn’t make it any “better”, just easier to leech. And why are you telling me to shut up?

Read full topic

item.title: Small question about sources
item.dc:creator: @spearo spearo
item.description:
@spearo wrote:

Alright thanks everyone, Since shard, hyperion, and runesource are the best ill have to make a pros and cons for those. Ill attempt learning java whack, as listed above iv started small bits of it.

Read full topic
